meanings.definition: A small, flat piece of metal used in jewelry making.
meanings.sent1: She carefully placed the bezil on the necklace she was crafting.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler soldered the bezil onto the silver pendant.
meanings.sent3: The bezil sparkled like a tiny mirror on the bracelet.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes lit up when she saw the bezil shine under the light.
meanings.sent5: The bezil gleamed like a precious gem in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to 1/20 of a shekel.
meanings.sent1: The merchant measured the spices using a bezil.
meanings.sent2: In ancient times, traders used bezils to weigh precious metals.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly added an extra bezil of salt to the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The bezil of gold felt heavy in his hand, a symbol of wealth.
meanings.sent5: The bezil balanced perfectly on the scale, indicating the exact weight.

meanings.definition: To set with bezils, as a watch.
meanings.sent1: He carefully beziled the watch to enhance its appearance.
meanings.sent2: The watchmaker bezils the timepiece with precision and skill.
meanings.sent3: She playfully beziled her watch with colorful gems for a unique look.
meanings.sent4: The watch seemed to bezil time itself, capturing moments in its hands.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design beziled on the watch made it a true work of art.
